subject: Communication
title: The Rule of Three
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Rule of Three.

hook.text: Life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness. Blood, sweat, and tears. Three just works.

buildup.text: Speakers have used triads for thousands of years because three items feel complete and memorable.

discovery.text: Cognitive research confirms: we remember groups of three better than two, four, or five.

twist.text: Two points feel incomplete. Four feels like a list. Three creates a pattern the brain can grasp.

climax.text: Steve Jobs used triads constantly: 'An iPod, a phone, an internet communicator.'

punchline.text: When in doubt, group it in threes.

quiz.question: Why is the rule of three effective in speeches?
options: Our brains remember three items best
